00020 #ifndef __MLPACK_CORE_OPTIMIZERS_LBFGS_TEST_FUNCTIONS_HPP
00021 #define __MLPACK_CORE_OPTIMIZERS_LBFGS_TEST_FUNCTIONS_HPP
00022 
00023 #include <mlpack/core.hpp>
00024 
00025 // To fulfill the template policy class 'FunctionType', we must implement
00026 // the following:
00027 //
00028 //   FunctionType(); // constructor
00029 //   void Gradient(const arma::mat& coordinates, arma::mat& gradient);
00030 //   double Evaluate(const arma::mat& coordinates);
00031 //   const arma::mat& GetInitialPoint();
00032 //
00033 // Note that we are using an arma::mat instead of the more intuitive and
00034 // expected arma::vec.  This is because L-BFGS will also optimize matrices.
00035 // However, remember that an arma::vec is simply an (n x 1) arma::mat.  You can
00036 // use either internally but the L-BFGS method requires arma::mat& to be passed
00037 // (C++ does not allow implicit reference casting to subclasses).
00038 
00039 namespace mlpack {
00040 namespace optimization {
00041 namespace test {

00055 class RosenbrockFunction
00056 {
00057  public:
00058   RosenbrockFunction(); // initialize initial point

00061   void Gradient(const arma::mat& coordinates, arma::mat& gradient);
00062 
00063   const arma::mat& GetInitialPoint() const;
00064 
00065  private:
00066   arma::mat initialPoint;
00067 };

00115 class GeneralizedRosenbrockFunction
00116 {
00117  public:
00118   /***
00119    * Set the dimensionality of the extended Rosenbrock function.
00120    *
00121    * @param n Number of dimensions for the function.
00122    */
00123   GeneralizedRosenbrockFunction(int n);
00124 
00125   double Evaluate(const arma::mat& coordinates) const;
00126   void Gradient(const arma::mat& coordinates, arma::mat& gradient) const;
00127 
00128   size_t NumFunctions() const { return n - 1; }
00129   double Evaluate(const arma::mat& coordinates, const size_t i) const;
00130   void Gradient(const arma::mat& coordinates,
00131                 const size_t i,
00132                 arma::mat& gradient) const;
00133 
00134   const arma::mat& GetInitialPoint() const;
00135 
00136  private:
00137   arma::mat initialPoint;
00138   int n; // Dimensionality
00139 };
